name: 楊任軒
objective: This course introduces students to the principles of catalytic reaction, reaction kinetics, synthesis of catalysts, characterization techniques and theories, and applications in environmental engineering and energy fields.
schedule:
1. Introduction and Basic Concepts
2. Adsorption (1)
3. Adsorption (2)
4. Rates and Kinetic Models of Catalytic Reactions (1)
5. Rates and Kinetic Models of Catalytic Reactions (2)
6. Catalyst Preparation and Manufacture (1)
7. Catalyst Preparation and Manufacture (2)
8. Catalyst Characterization and Examination (1)
9. Catalyst Characterization and Examination (2)
10. Mid-term exam
11. Supported Metal Catalysts (1)
12. Supported Metal Catalysts (2)
13. Acid and Zeolite Catalysts (1)
14. Acid and Zeolite Catalysts (2)
15. Catalysts for Energy-related Technologies
16. Catalysts for Cleaner Production Processes and Environmental Protection
17. Case Studies and Future Perspectives
18. Final Presentation
scorePolicy: Mid-term exam (30%), Presentation, report, discussion (40%), Attendance and Participation (30%)
materials:
Self-prepared slides and other references:
1. Satterfield, “Heterogeneous Catalysis in Industrial Practice”
2. Thomas, “Principles and Practice of Heterogeneous Catalysis”
remarks:
本學期原則採實體授課方式； 因應疫情警戒標準，本學期教學及授課方式請依照學校網頁所公布之訊息為準： (https://oaa.ntut.edu.tw/p/404-1008-98622.php?Lang=zh-tw)
The class could be held remotely once the COVID-19 level upgrades to level 3 or depends on the announcement of NTUT. If we had a remote class, Microsoft Teams will be used for the remote lecture.
